main.name: Cody Ferguson
main.description: I currently work at Kohl's on the Planning Engineering team building internal web applications.
main.bio: Growing up, I always wanted to be an Engineer. Combined with my interest in computers, I pursued becoming a Software Engineer at The Univeristy of Wisconsin - Platteville. I currently work on web based applications at Kohl's. I enjoy experimenting with new technology and hobby game development while I am not working on DIY projects for my home.

resume.skillmessage: I love to learn new tech stacks, and experirement with different areas of software development. Here are some of the technologies I am most familiar with.

education.description: A focus on hands on learning with projects using Java, C#, C++, and C. Alongside coding, software engineering classes demonstrated the steps of the software development life cycle.

work.title: Associate Software Engineer
work.description: After the Great Start rotational program, I was assigned to the Merchandising Service Delivery team where I developed applications to help my co workers support Merchandising applications. Then I moved to the Merchandising Engineering team where I began working on an internal planning software. I started by implementing improvements to buy worksheets functionality. I was then moved to the program planning where we designed new functionality around planning many programs under one planner which greatly increased their productivity. I took this time to refactor code from the Angular components to reuse for bulk actions which decoupled the logic into a service file. I also lead the conversion of our batch job orchestration from running on a mainframe to using Airflow which aligned with Kohl's move off the mainframe.

work.title: Associate Software Engineer - Great Start
work.description: I started at Kohl's on a rotational program where I first helped the Omni-channel Fulfilment team in developing a tool to check the discrepancies between two internal inventory systems. Then, I assisted the Merchandise Service Delivery team by developing applications that improved my co-workers ability to support Merchandising applications. I was quickly exposed to enterprise projects, and learned a great amount during the rotation

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: I Designed and implemented improvements to ServiceNow pages. Also, I participated in a Shark Tank like intern presentation on an innovative idea presented to Kohl's upper management. This was great exposure to working with a diverse team to drive innovation, and present to the CTO.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: I developed automated tests for LightGuide, an in-house software, using Telerik's Test Studio. Created manual tests for LightGuide running on a research and develoment laser. While developing the manual tests, and trying to find good designs for test cases, I uncovered a hard to find edge case which helped the senior developers find the underlying issue.
